content.description: A <math alttext="95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence interval for the mean weight, in thousands of pounds, of African bush elephants is determined to be <math alttext="open parenthesis, 12.2 comma 14.6, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>12.2</mn><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mn>14.6</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>.
content.question: Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the interval?

choices.label: We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of African bush elephants weigh between <math alttext="12.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds and <math alttext="14.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds.

The probability is <math alttext="0.95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> that the population mean weight of African bush elephants is between <math alttext="12.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds and <math alttext="14.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds.

We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the population mean weight of African bush elephants is between <math alttext="12.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds and <math alttext="14.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds.

We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the population mean weight of African bush elephants is <math alttext="13.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>13.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds, which is the midpoint of the interval.

We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the mean weight calculated from a different sample of African bush elephants would be between <math alttext="12.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds and <math alttext="14.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds.

content.answer: We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the population mean weight of African bush elephants is between <math alttext="12.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds and <math alttext="14.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> thousand pounds.

topic.text: 7.3: Justifying a Claim About a Population Mean Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
